title: Tour Lima de día en bus panorámico + Catacumbas de San Francisco
description: Discover the essence of Lima with a 360-degree view of the City of Kings on our exclusive Mirabus tour. Immerse yourself in the cultural, architectural, and historical richness of the city center as you explore its iconic streets, palaces, balconies, and monuments that tell the fascinating story of this metropolis. Prepare your senses for a unique experience that will transport you through time.
all_descriptions: Discover the essence of Lima with a 360-degree view of the City of Kings on our exclusive Mirabus tour. Immerse yourself in the cultural, architectural, and historical richness of the city center as you explore its iconic streets, palaces, balconies, and monuments that tell the fascinating story of this metropolis. Prepare your senses for a unique experience that will transport you through time.

ItineraryThis is a typical itinerary for this productPass By:Lima, Lima, Lima RegionWe begin our journey in the vibrant district of Miraflores, heading toward the Historic Center. Along the way, we will make a panoramic stop at the Huaca Pucllana Archaeological Site, a testament to 1,500 years of history. Panoramic tour.Pass By:Circuito Magico Del Agua, Jr. Madre de Dios Parque de la Reserva, Lima 15046 PeruBefore diving into the historic heart of the city, we’ll pass by the Park of the Reserve on a panoramic tour aboard the Mirabus. This park is home to the famous Magic Water Circuit, recognized with a Guinness World Record. Enjoy the world’s largest fountain complex in a public park. Panoramic tour.Pass By:Supreme Court of Perú, Av. Paseo de la República, Lima 15001, PeruThe Palace of Justice of Peru is an impressive building located in Lima, serving as the main headquarters of the country's Judiciary. Inaugurated in 1939, its monumental design, inspired by the Palace of Justice in Brussels, reflects the significance of the judicial system in Peruvian society. With its neoclassical architecture, it houses the Supreme Court of Justice and administrative offices. It stands as a symbol of the rule of law and an important historical and cultural landmark in Peru.Pass By:Plaza San Martin, Av. Nicolas de Pierola cdra. 9, Lima 15001 PeruSan Martín Square, inaugurated in 1921 in the heart of Lima, is a symbol of the centenary of Peru's independence. Surrounded by elegant neocolonial-style buildings, it is distinguished by its imposing central monument honoring the liberator Don José de San Martín. This iconic city landmark is perfect for appreciating its history and architecture. Panoramic tour.Pass By:Centro Historico de Lima, Plaza de Armas, Lima 15001 PeruWe explore Grau Square, the Naval Heroes Promenade, and San Martín Square. We'll stroll through the pedestrian streets of the historic center, where the most important government buildings stand, such as the Presidential Palace, the Metropolitan Municipality of Lima, the Archbishop's Palace, and the Lima Cathedral. This walking tour will take place as long as the Plaza de Armas of Lima isStop At:Museo Convento San Francisco y Catacumbas, Jiron Ancash, Lima 15001 PeruThe Convent of San Francisco de Jesús El Grande in Lima, inaugurated in 1672, is a prominent monument of Peruvian viceregal art and a Cultural Heritage of the Nation. Since 1968, it has housed a museum preserving a rich historical and artistic collection accumulated by the Franciscan order over more than 400 years. The collection includes architecture, paintings, liturgical ornaments, silverware, and more. The Catacombs, featuring human remains in underground passages, are a notable attraction. The convent also hosts cultural activities such as lectures, courses, concerts, and artistic performances.Duration: 35 minutes

Mirabus, Av. Petit Thouars 5492, Miraflores 15074, PeruMirabus, Av. Petit Thouars 5492, Miraflores 15074, Peru
https://maps.app.goo.gl/9ucS8bUEWEdiLGWz5
End:This activity ends back at the meeting point.

Buen City tour

Good option if you don't know and you don't have how to move in lime to have an overview of the area.... they were very friendly and picked us up on the way as we didn't reach the schedule of the game.... it leaves from miraflores , saint isidro passes by the square of arms and saint martin square to know the historical center of lime, where the guide goes down with the group to tell the story, then continues to the church where the catacombs are. Photos are not allowed but it is an interesting place to visit. A good walk!! All very friendly

Terrible customer service

Apr 2024 • Friends
They mistreated us, the lady who attended the point treated us with anger, she put on headphones to not give us information. He spoke badly to us, we told him that he shouldn't treat us like that, and he got up and came too close to me. HORROR. He gave us bad information and we lost 2 hours of our day. :(
Very sad to be treated like this on vacation.
Written April 13, 2024
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
S. Schnuppe
16 contributions

Zero-eight-fifteen-tourist tour

Mar 2024 • Couples
The departure was on time, and the journey to the center was also quite quick, with explanations in Spanish and English. From the center, we continued on foot. At the Plaza Mayor, we had to listen to very long and detailed explanations in both languages, standing and in the blazing sun. Hardly anyone was listening, but they droned on. Then we went on to the catacombs and then to a souvenir shop, where we could try and buy Pisco. On to the bus stop, then we stood in the blazing sun for almost half an hour and the bus didn't leave. All buses had a shade roof - except this one. It wasn't that spectacular, you could have taken public transport there too.
Written March 11, 2024
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
MSK-RUS
Moscow, Russia4,351 contributions

A good first tour to explore Lima

We took this tour on our first day in Lima. The stop was located 500 meters from our hotel, which certainly determined our decision. They have 2 tour start times at 11 and 14:30, we originally booked for 11 but then moved to 14:30. The guide was very informative and conducted the tour perfectly in 2 languages, which was very convenient. He paid time and attention to everyone, but there were only 12 of us for the whole bus. I especially liked the main square and the Catacombs and the pisco tasting at the very end of the tour.
Written January 15, 2024
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Janice L
6 contributions

Not a good experience

Nov 2022
Although our tour guide spoke English and Spanish, her Spanish explanations were much longer and for the English part she just read aloud the tourist signs around the Basilica. She also only aimed the tour at a few specific people and ignored everybody else. It just didn't feel worth it to have the tour, even though I spoke both Spanish and English, because she didn't put much effort in.

She also was unable to answer most follow-up questions we had about the things she was showing us- her main reply was that we should research it ourselves.
Written November 12, 2022
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
ILMtraveler2
Leland, NC123 contributions

Good tour for the price

Jul 2022
We took a late afternoon tour, which we started and ended at their office across from the Mercado Indio in Miraflores. We were tired from a busy day of touring and enjoyed a very pleasant tour from the upper deck of the bus. There were no stops on this afternoon tour and the narration was in Spanish and English . It can be a little chilly in Lima so bring an extra layer to wrap up in. It didn't costs all that much and we felt that it was a good value. We definitely got to see some areas that we could never have covered on foot.
Written August 5, 2022
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Andy_Wld
Dnipro, Ukraine100 contributions

Nice city overview on a go

Jan 2022
An excellent service and timing and guide was very helpful and very organized. This is a convenient way to see the sites without having to worry about a potentially expensive tour. The guide explained the sites in both English and Spanish. Entrance fees were included in the tickets which was nice. We did not have in the tour San Francisco and the catacombs as of pandemic situation and even Plaza de Armas of Lima was closed but our Guide did a great job to let us in and show around. There are 4 tours a day 2h (30 Soles) and 3 h (60 Soles) tours. I took 3h Tour at 10:30am for 60 Soles on the bus and I was lucky to see San Isidro, City Downtown, Miraflores, Lince, Barranco, Chorrillos and a part of Costa Verde (from Miraflores to Chorrillos). It was a great experience comparison to 85 dollar tour I had before and I got only walking tour in the city downtown and Magic Water Circuit (15 minutes show and walk inside the fountain park and entrance costs 5 Soles).
Written January 18, 2022
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Not good experience

Everything needs to be improved starting from issue of tickets, I was boarded with no ticket just a sticker, the description during the trip was poor without any useful information and/or reference to the history of place visited, but the most was at second stop the guide gave 6 mins !! for pictures and suddenly he left leaving on the square of church 3 passengers, he collect some other PAx and left.
We were able to catch one rep of the company and he admit is quite common situation, the phone call to head office resulted that we were the guilty and the tour is not private so go back by yourself to hotel. If you are very patient and open to be left in the street .....you can enjoy
Written February 26, 2020
